text: Cortinarius subcalyptrosporus is a fungus native to Borneo, where it was originally collected by E.J.H. Corner on the slopes of Mount Kinabalu in 1964 and described by Meinhard Michael Moser in 1986. Specimens from New Zealand classified as this species are Cortinarius kioloensis. It is poorly known. The mushroom is wholly dark purple with slightly paler flesh, and closely resembles Cortinarius violaceus. ==See also== *List of Cortinarius species ==References== ==External links== * subcalyptrosporus Category:Fungi described in 1986 Category:Fungi of Malaysia
title: Cortinarius subcalyptrosporus
